messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2804
messages.msgSnippet: ... trying ... move, ... When we got farther apart it was both of us, me in reaction to him.  This time I think maybe it s the other way.  I ve moved in a
messages.messageBody:
> > So is it just moving
> > from a hard to an easy period in his growth, or is it that I've been
trying
> > to pay attention to what he *is* doing rather than what I *wish* he was
> > doing? Or a bit of both?
>
> That's one of those questions I ask myself in relationships occasionally.
> We're father apart, hmmmm. I wonder who moved. Did the other person
move,
> or did I?
>
> Nobody can really answer that but you, Tia, but I can say from my own
> experience that I'm often the one who's moved.

When we got farther apart it was both of us, me in reaction to him. This
time I think maybe it's the other way. I've moved in a little closer in
ways that he can handle. That lets him move in a little closer too. And .
. . I think he's getting easier with all the changes he's been going
through, easier with being "different".
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2804
messages.msgSnippet: ... That s one of those questions I ask myself in relationships occasionally. We re father apart, hmmmm.  I wonder who moved.  Did the other person move, or
messages.messageBody:
1/7/03 13:49:

> So is it just moving
> from a hard to an easy period in his growth, or is it that I've been trying
> to pay attention to what he *is* doing rather than what I *wish* he was
> doing? Or a bit of both?

That's one of those questions I ask myself in relationships occasionally.
We're father apart, hmmmm. I wonder who moved. Did the other person move,
or did I?

Nobody can really answer that but you, Tia, but I can say from my own
experience that I'm often the one who's moved.

brenda
